bibl.title: Reconstructing the First Steps of Hellenistic Ethnography. The Nomima Barbarika of P. Lond. Lit. 112 Reconsidered.
Archiv für Papyrusforschung und verwandte Gebiete

bibl.note: An earlier version of this work was presented at the conference ""IV Jornadas de Estudios Papirológicos"" (Salamanca, 2012). New overview of P. lit. Lond. 112 [= M.-P.3 2183; LDAB 403], long considered to be a possible fragment of the lost collection of ethnographical material known as Νόμιμα βαρβαρικά that originated with Aristoteles. The papyrus, rather than being Aristotelician, could be a fragment of the lost paradoxographic collection of ethnographic anecdotes compiled by Nymphodorus of Amphipolis. - Avec résumé en anglais.
